ViewDef.Title: VM Memory Size Distribution
ViewDef.Description: Absolute distribution of VM configured memory. Minimize the large VMs, especially those exceeding the size of the underlying NUMA, as they can create performance and capacity problem.

ViewDef.Title: VM Hardware Version
ViewDef.Description:
Absolute distribution of VM hardware version (VMX). Newer hardware enables new capabilities and ensure compatibility with later vSphere release. VMX-16: Workstation 15 VMX-15: vSphere 6.7 U2 VMX-14: vSphere 6.7 VMX-13: vSphere 6.5
This view is used in dashboard: Configuration \ VM

ViewDef.Title: VM Snapshot Size
ViewDef.Description: Absolute distribution of VM by their snapshot size. Snapshots are temporary protection, so a large indicates unexpected result. Investigates the age too, as even small snapshot should not be left for days or weeks.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Resource Pool Configuration
ViewDef.Description: List of resource pools. Pay attention to resource pool with limit, shares and reservation.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster Configuration List
ViewDef.Description: Lists the summary of the cluster configuration for different Clusters in your environment.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi BIOS Versions
ViewDef.Description: Displays the aggregated data about the BIOS versions for different host systems in your environment.

ViewDef.Title: Guest OS Partition List
ViewDef.Description: List of Guest OS filesystem partitions and their capacity. It's more important to monitor disk space inside each partition than at VM virtual disk level, because that matters more to the application. This visibility inside the Guest OS is delivered by vSphere Tools.

ViewDef.Title: VM Growth Trend
ViewDef.Description: Trend line of VM growth. It shows both the powered on and powered off, to see the relative movement over time

ViewDef.Title: ESXi HyperThread Active
ViewDef.Description: Count of ESXi hosts where the CPU Hyper-Threading (HT) is disabled. For better overall througput, enable HT.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi Power Management (BIOS)
ViewDef.Description: Compare with the value at ESXi level

ViewDef.Title: VM Disk Latency Distribution for Profiling
ViewDef.Description: Distribution of VMs by their disk latency. It's using the 20 second, not 5-minute average. The 99th value of the monitoring period is shown (as opposed to the worst). The bar chart is segregated into 10 buckets, so you can better see the spread. Each bucket is color coded, showing different threshold.

Property.name: localizedAttributeName
Property.value: Virtual Disk|Peak Latency within collection cycle (ms)

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster Performance List 1
ViewDef.Description: List of clusters and their key performance. Because it focuses on proactive monitoring, the worst counter is shown. The Performance SLA uses a high standard, hence both the 95th percentile and worst are shown. 95th is used instead of 99th because there can be false positive from Network counter.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Port Group Forged Transmit
ViewDef.Description: Count of distributed port groups that allow forged transmit. Minimize this for security reason, and only use for the use case it's designed for.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster Admission Control Policy
ViewDef.Description: Relative distribution of cluster admission control policies.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere ESXi Memory Utilization
ViewDef.Description: Trend line of ESXi host memory utilization. Value is in GB, so the actual quantity is known. It's used in Capacity Management context, hence it's showing 3 months time horizon and the value is hourly averaged to show the big picture. Total, Usable Capacity and actual consumed are shown. It's healthy for consumed to be very high as ESXi uses memory as cache. So long Active is low and Balloon is 0, ESXi is not under memory pressure.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Port Group Inventory
ViewDef.Description: Lists vSphere Distributed Port Groups with necessary information for inventory purpose.

ViewDef.Title: VM Storage Heavy Hitters
ViewDef.Description: List of vSphere VMs with that hit the storage hard. Both IOPS and Throughput are shown, as a VM with large block size can generate high throughput with moderate IOPS. The view also lists a 1-hour max. 1 hour = 3600 seconds. A VM doing 100 IOPS on average sustained over 1 hour is actually generating 36K IO operations. To help you focus on the VMs that hit the storage hard, VMs that are not doing so is filtered out. The threshold used is 100 IOPS sustained in the last collection cycle.

ViewDef.Title: Guest OS Memory Utilization
ViewDef.Description: Trend line of VM memory utilization. Value is in GB, so the actual quantity is known. It's used in Capacity Management context, hence it's showing 3 months time horizon and the value is daily averaged to show the big picture. Total and Memory Needed are shown. Memory Needed is used as it does not measure what the Guest OS uses, but what it needs. Windows/Linux uses cache as part of memory management, and this needs to be accounted for in sizing.

ViewDef.Title: Datastore Type
ViewDef.Description: Relative distribution of datastores by types (NFS, VMFS, vSAN, vVOL). Local datastores are excluded to avoid skewing the result.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Performance Profiling
ViewDef.Description: Profile the IaaS performance by looking at the KPI for all VMs. The 99th percentile are used, as 100th (worst) will be driven by outlier, and 99th (99%) is too low for SLA. Compare the values before and after optimization.

Property.name: displayName
Property.value: The VM Peak Memory Contention at the 99th percentile of entire collection period

Property.name: displayName
Property.value: The VM Peak Disk Latency at the 99th percentile of entire collection period

Property.name: displayName
Property.value: The VM Peak CPU Ready at the 99th percentile of entire collection period

ViewDef.Title: VM with many Network Cards
ViewDef.Description: Absolute distribution of VM by count of network cards. VM with >1 NIC can potentially bridge a network. Some VMs may have >1 network, such as data network, management network, backup network.

Property.name: localizedAttributeName
Property.value: Summary|Guest Operating System|Guest OS IP Address

ViewDef.Title: vSAN Host Distribution
ViewDef.Description: Relative distribution of types of vSAN clusters. Some possible values are VxRail and Regular (means non VxRail)

ViewDef.Title: VM Snapshot by Size
ViewDef.Description: Distribution of VM by their snapshots size. Snapshots are temporary protection, so a large one indicates unexpected result. Investigates the age too. If it's old, then it could be a forgotten snapshot. It's showing snapshot that is older than 1 day, as daily back up typically creates a snapshot.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi CPU Speed
ViewDef.Description:
Relative distribution of ESXi hosts, by their CPU size in GHz. Keep them minimal. Also, pay attention to small hosts as they have relatively higher overhead, hence less optimized. To change the threshold, go to filter tab.
Known issue: due to rounding limitation, CPU with very similar speed is shown as separate slices.

ViewDef.Title: VM with RDM disks
ViewDef.Description: VM having Raw Device Mapping devices instead of virtual disk (VMDK file). They increase operational complexity.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere ESXi CPU Utilization
ViewDef.Description: Trend line of ESXi CPU utilization. Both the Thread Utilization and Core Utilization. As the context is capacity, focus on thread.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi CPU Models
ViewDef.Description: Absolute distribution of ESXi hosts, by their CPU model. Keep them minimal. Also, pay attention to small hosts as they have relatively higher overhead, hence less optimized. To change the threshold, go to filter tab.

ViewDef.Title: Guest OS Memory Paging Trend
ViewDef.Description: Trend line of memory performance at Guest OS levels. There is no counters that VM level that maps to this counter, so if this counter is blank then install Tools. It's used in Performance Management context, hence it's showing 1 week time horizon and the value is not averaged.

ViewDef.Title: VM Performance
ViewDef.Description:
List of VMs and their utilization. It's used in Performance, not Capacity Management context. To support proactive operations, the worst value in the last 1 day is shown.
As this focuses on performance, powered off VMs are excluded.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster CPU Utilization
ViewDef.Description: Trend line of cluster CPU utilization. Value is in percentage, where 100% means the cluster has reached the Usable Capacity. Usable Capacity is Total Capacity minus HA and Buffer. It's used in Capacity Management context, hence it's showing 3 months time horizon and the value is hourly averaged.

ViewDef.Title: VM Tools States
ViewDef.Description: Relative distribution of VMware Tools by their states. Ensure all are running, up to date and managed.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Port Group Forged Transmit Allowed
ViewDef.Description: Count of distributed port groups that allow forged transmit. Minimize this for security reason, and only use for the use case it's designed for.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster Memory Utilization
ViewDef.Description:
Trend line of cluster memory utilization.
It's used in Capacity Management context, hence it's showing 3 months time horizon and the value is hourly averaged. The counter consumed is used instead of active, because consumed is used to trigger balloon.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster Allocation
ViewDef.Description: Trend line of cluster allocation. This complements the demand model as demand model cannot account for newly provisioned VMs that are not yet active. It's used in Capacity Management context, hence it's showing 3 months time horizon and the value is hourly averaged.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster Performance Profiling
ViewDef.Description:
List of clusters and their main performance counters. Because it is used in SLA development, the worst counter is shown and then we take the 99th percentile over 1 month.
Shared datastores with at least 1 active VM only

ViewDef.Title: Guest OS CPU Queue Trend
ViewDef.Description: It's showing 20-second peak and not 5 minute as the context is performance, not capacity.

ViewDef.Title: VM Network Card Configuration
ViewDef.Description: Lists the NIC configuration of a VM

ViewDef.Title: VM Memory Contention Distribution
ViewDef.Description:
Distribution of VMs by their memory contention. It's using the 20-second Peak metric, not the average metric.
It's showing the 99th percentile, and not the peak. This balances between false positive (showing outlier) and too late. 99th is chosen and not 95th as it's designed for early warning.
The bar chart is segregated into different buckets. Each bucket is color coded, showing different threshold.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi HyperThread Capability
ViewDef.Description: Count of ESXi hosts where the CPU Hyper-Threading (HT) is disabled. For better overall througput, enable HT.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi Utilization List
ViewDef.Description: List of ESXi hosts and their utilization. The context is capacity management, not performance. The threshold is adjusted by 10%, as it assumes a cluster has 1 HA host.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi Switch property
ViewDef.Description: List of ESXi hosts connected to the distributed switch, along with their key network properties.

ViewDef.Title: VM CPU Ready Distribution for Profiling
ViewDef.Description: Distribution of VMs by their CPU Ready. It's using the 20 second peak metric. The 99th value of the monitoring period is shown (as opposed to the worst). The bar chart is segregated into 10 buckets, so you can better see the spread. Each bucket is color coded, showing different threshold.

Property.name: localizedAttributeName
Property.value: CPU|Peak vCPU Ready within collection cycle (%)

ViewDef.Title: VM Distribution by Capacity Remaining
ViewDef.Description: Count of VMs, grouped by the capacity remaining. The view is color coded for quick analysis

ViewDef.Title: VMware Tools Version
ViewDef.Description:
Distribution of VMware Tools by their version. Check those that are likely outdated. Enhance this by filtering out the versions that are not outdated.
Enhance this widget by filtering out up to date versions.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Distributed Switch Configuration
ViewDef.Description: List of distributed switches for configuration management purpose

ViewDef.Title: VM Snapshot Trend
ViewDef.Description: vSphere VM snapshot over time. If this has been going on for days, it could be forgotten snapshot.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi Network Cards List
ViewDef.Description: List the summary of the network properties associated with the Distributed Virtual Switch for the selected Host System in your environment.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster DPM Status
ViewDef.Description: vSphere Cluster DPM configuration status, where true = enabled.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster HA Admission Control status
ViewDef.Description:
Relative distribution of clusters HA admission control status. You should enable admission control as part of vSphere best practices.
true = enabled

ViewDef.Title: VM Virtual Disk Distribution
ViewDef.Description:
Relative distribution of VMs by their number of virtual disks. Minimize those with many virtual disks as it creates islands of disk space. Since a VM needs to have at least 1 disk, I've excluded VM with just 1 virtual disk so those with many are more visible.
Note: virtual disk includes RDM and VMDK.
